hint: Push filters into derived tables early and convert implicit joins to explicit JOINs to give the optimizer better selectivity estimates and join order control.
Isolate selective date and dimension filters into separate CTEs, then join with fact tables using explicit JOIN syntax to reduce intermediate result sizes.
Pre-filter all dimension and fact tables into materialized CTEs, then perform joins in a controlled order to minimize large table scans.
Break the self-join pattern by computing aggregations once in CTEs, then derive metrics, and use explicit join ordering to avoid duplicate work.
